instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521 5V 0.60A dfu mode
threads.message:
no water damage just suddenly dead mac..
its on DFU mode directly(I was not put it in first place), was try to restore/revive but all the time get error:
"unexpected device state 'dfu' expected 'recovery' 
(probably forced into dfu mode externally) 
[com.apple.mobiledevice.mobilerestore – 0xfae (4014)]"

PPBUS_G3H 13.7V
*pp3v3/LDO 3.7V
PP1V8_AWAKE 2V
PP1V2_AWAKE 1.4V
PP3V3_AWAKE 3.7V
PP1V8_ SLPS2R 2V
PP1V25_ SLPS2R 1.4V
PP1V1_ SLPS2R 1.2V

threads.title: 820-01521 5V 0.60A dfu mode
threads.message:
All posted voltages are higher than nominal.
I bet your multimeter needs new battery.

Did you try PRAM reset?
